content.title: Kasabach-Merritt Phenomenon
content.description: Consumptive coagulopathy associated with kaposiform hemangioendothelioma or tufted angioma

key_concepts.details: NOT associated with infantile hemangioma; occurs with KHE or tufted angioma only
Platelet trapping within tumor causes profound thrombocytopenia and consumption of clotting factors
Severe thrombocytopenia (<10,000), low fibrinogen, elevated D-dimer
Sirolimus (mTOR inhibitor) emerging as first-line; vincristine, corticosteroids historically used

content.clinical_significance: Medical emergency with mortality up to 30% if untreated
